Authors:
Meng Zhou, Josef Vlasák, Masoomeh Ghobad-Nejhad, Young Woon
Lim, Yu Cheng Dai
Title:
Taxonomy and an updated phylogeny of Anomoloma
(Amylo-corticiales, Basidiomycota)
Keywords:
phylogenetic analysis; Amylocorticiales; taxonomy;
wood-rotting fungi
Abstract:
Anomoloma is a cosmopolitan white rot fungal genus,
belonging to Amylocorticiales. During a study on wood-decaying fungi,
two new species of the genus are found based on the samples col-lected
from China and Europe, and they are described as Anomoloma denticulatum
and A. eurasiati-cum. Phylogenetic analyses are carried out based on
sequences from the internal transcribed spac-er regions (ITS) and the
large subunit of nuclear ribosomal RNA gene (nLSU). The result
demon-strates that Anomoloma denticulatum and A. eurasiaticum are
clearly distinct species within Ano-moloma. Both new species share the
principal characteristics of the genus, but Anomoloma denticu-latum is
characterized by extensive white rhizomorphs spread under the whole
fruiting body, an-gular pores measuring 12 per mm, distinctly lacerate
to dentate dissepiments and ellipsoid basid-iospores measuring 3.54.3 ×
22.5 μm. Anomoloma eurasiaticum is characterized by bearing plenty of
large crystals on mycelia and growth on Picea in high altitude areas. A
key to accepted species of Anomoloma worldwide is provided.
